subject: Climate & Environment
title: Smog in Modern Megacities
description: Learn Smog in Modern Megacities in one minute.

hook.text: Delhi, Beijing, and Lahore regularly hit PM2.5 levels 20 times above WHO safety limits.

buildup.text: Rapid industrialization, coal power, and millions of vehicles crowd the air with pollutants.

discovery.text: Crop burning in surrounding farmland adds massive seasonal spikes to city pollution.

twist.text: Schools close, flights cancel, and hospitals fill during the worst smog events.

climax.text: China cut PM2.5 by 40% in major cities between 2013 and 2020 through aggressive regulation.

punchline.text: Megacity smog is a crisis â€” and China proved it can be fought.
